abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Nicaragua and Honduras Corazon Transboundary Biosphere
            Reserve Project is to improve the national and binational
            management of the area of the Corazon Transboundary
            Biosphere Reserve (CTBR), respecting the rights of
            traditional populations. The closing of the project will be
            extended from from August 1, 2012 to December 15, 2012. The
            purpose of the extension is to ensure that the results of
            the project are adequately measured and that the lessons
            learned are captured and disseminated. The reallocation of
            grant proceeds is thus needed to ensure that Technical
            Assistance (TA) and Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E)
            expenditures related to implementation of subprojects are
            accounted for consistent with disbursement categories
            specified in the grant agreement. This reallocation does not
            impact the amount of funding approved per component, and
            specifically funding approved for subprojects and grants.
            The reallocation only affects the categories of expenditure
            as defined in the grant agreement. This will be the first
            extension of the project.
